body:
Hi,
I just modified the field 'data' to data type varchar(max) and works

issue.title: Microsoft SQL Server error with 'yii\web\DbSession'

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Create table `session` using migration:

```
        $this->createTable('{{%session}}', [
            'id' => $this->string()->notNull(),
            'expire' => $this->integer(),
            'data' => $this->binary(),
            'PRIMARY KEY ([[id]])',
        ]);
```

Configure session handler:

```
        'session'      => [
            'class'        => 'yii\web\DbSession',
            'sessionTable' => '{{%session}}',
        ]
```

Run web application.
### What is the expected result?

No error
### What do you get instead?

Session data are not written into database because of error:

```
Exception (Database Exception) 'yii\db\Exception' with message 
'SQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]Implicit conversion from data type nvarchar to binary is not allowed. Use the CONVERT function to run this query.
The SQL being executed was: 
INSERT INTO [session] ([data], [id], [expire]) VALUES ('__flash|a:0:{}dummy|s:5:"12345";', '9ds6jo8mg1j2dctk8ifip3mbd7', 1474802513)' 
```

Error is repeated with `session.serialize_handler` value set to `php_serialize`, `php` and `php_binary`.
### Additional info

| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Yii version | 2.0.9 |
| PHP version | 5.5.16 |
| Operating system | Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard Edition |

**pdo_sqlsrv**

```
Microsoft SQL Server 2012 (SP1) - 11.0.3156.0 (X64) 
    May  4 2015 18:48:09 
    Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation
    Standard Edition (64-bit) on Windows NT 6.2 <X64> (Build 9200: ) (Hypervisor)
```

body:
PHP 7.1.10
Yii 2.0.12
SQL Server 2017
DbSession

having problems decoding session from DbSession on MS SQL with [data] column as VARBINARY(MAX).
session decode is Failing. changed the datatype to nvarchar(max) and it seems to be working..

issue.title: Fixed DbSession for Microsoft SQL Server, enhanced tests

repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.title: Implicit conversion from data type char to varbinary(max) is not allowed

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
i use yii2-admin with sql server, when i create role, assign role and etc, I always get an error. 
i look this problem just in rbac, cz in other CRUD still work.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9190451/32312503-bb45c66e-bfd0-11e7-89b5-612bd80148eb.png)

### What is the expected result?
how to solve this rbac problem?

### What do you get instead?
SQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 13 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Implicit conversion from data type char to varbinary(max) is not allowed. Use the CONVERT function to run this query.
The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO [auth_item] ([name], [type], [description], [rule_name], [data], [created_at], [updated_at]) VALUES ('test', 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, 1509601715, 1509601715)
Error Info: Array
(
    [0] => 42000
    [1] => 257
    [2] => [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 13 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Implicit conversion from data type char to varbinary(max) is not allowed.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.12
| PHP version      | 7.1
| Operating system | SQL Server
